intro: Pachygone laevigata, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed pachygone, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its thick, smooth stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in humid, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
